intro: Chiliotrichiopsis peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian featherleaf, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves that give it its common name, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Chiliotrichiopsis peruviana is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and fragrance. It prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for shaded garden beds or container cultivation.
